{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3537486,"name":"","username":"ConnorG","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/65b543/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-23T22:10:34.167Z","cooked":"

Hello,
My team is using CTRE Motion Magic Voltage to control a single-joint arm that moves on an elevator. The arm is fairly small and light, and is powered by a Kraken X60 through a 45:1 reduction using a 15:1 (3:1 + 5:1) Maxplanetary and a custom Lantern Gear. The issue is that our controller allows the arm to move a significant amount (± 6 degrees) before it actually fights back with enough torque to return to the ±6 degree range.
However, the issue does not seem to be a result of mechanical backlash. When we move the arm within the ± 6 degree range where the controller doesn’t really fight the error, we can still see the position changing accurately. We can see the position changing on BOTH the motor encoder and the absolute 1:1 Cancoder within this ± 6 degree range. Because we have both motor and abolute encoders, we are using Fused Cancoder which gives us very accurate position data. Overall, the Motor to Arm overall backlash is not very much, and the total backlash in the fused cancoder system is even less. All of it is significantly less than ± 6 degrees.
The controller is using kP, kS (Tried both velocity sign and closed loop sign), kG, along with motion magic acceleration and velocity constraints. Aside from the issue moves quickly from setpoint to setpoint, does not oscillate, and is within 0.01 rotations of the setpoint after it moves. The problem is that the position isn’t stable while moving around on the field, because the controller isn’t fighting the error enough once the error is less than ~6 degrees. If you move the arm, by hand, within the range, the error is seen, but the controller doesn’t really do anything about it. Once you get outside that range, however, the controller quickly fights the error and returns the arm to that within the ± 6 degree range.
Please help us. We have tried a lot of things so far and nothing has helped resolve this issue.

6 degrees is suspiciously similar to 0.1 radians, which someone may have put into a “tolerance” field somewhere.

Phoenix 5 used to have such a thing, but it was dropped in Phoenix 6.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-02-23T23:53:13.340Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":39.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492886,"topic_slug":"ctre-motionmagic-strange-arm-control-issue","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/ctre-motionmagic-strange-arm-control-issue/492886/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3537571,"name":"Sam Viesselman","username":"samviesselman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/samviesselman/{size}/237998_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T00:00:47.603Z","cooked":"

From what you described, I think we can rule out mechanical backlash as the source of the issue.

Have you ensured that no output deadbands are on the motor? We’ve run into issues where the default CTRE output deadband has prevented us from reaching our setpoints. This can happen when you have a high gear ratio for a light mechanism and need very little voltage to move it.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-02-24T00:00:47.603Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":116,"readers_count":115,"score":78.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492886,"topic_slug":"ctre-motionmagic-strange-arm-control-issue","display_username":"Sam Viesselman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":37087,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/ctre-motionmagic-strange-arm-control-issue/492886/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3537575,"name":"","username":"ConnorG","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/65b543/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T00:05:45.654Z","cooked":"
truher:

“tolerance” field somewhere.

We ran the control on a temporary diagnostic server through TunerX and still had the same issue. There shouldn’t be any tolerance on it in TunerX as it should always be trying to reach the given setpoint.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-02-24T00:05:45.654Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":107,"readers_count":106,"score":36.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492886,"topic_slug":"ctre-motionmagic-strange-arm-control-issue","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73728,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/ctre-motionmagic-strange-arm-control-issue/492886/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3537588,"name":"","username":"ConnorG","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/65b543/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T00:21:45.972Z","cooked":"

We have tried both a 0.04 deadband and 0 deadband in tunerX. This was using the DutyCycleNeutralDeadband. We were setting the deadband to 0.04 in code because we copied the motor factory code from someone else who was doing that. We tried 0 deadband through TunerX, but not through setting it in code. Neither seems to have fixed the issue.
We will try setting a deadband of 0 in code tommorow.

How did you tune your kp? It may not me high enough.
